it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.controller.weapons.effects

Class AbstractEffect

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.controller.weapons.effects.AbstractEffect
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MovementEffect, TargetingEffect

    public abstract class AbstractEffect
extends Object
    Represents an effect that can be used in a weapon.

    The effect is identified inside the weapon by its id and it can depend on other effects. This means that it can't be executed if those effects have not been executed yet.

    The effect can also have an additional cost that the user is obliged to pay in order to use it.

    If the effect isOptional() it means that it can be executed before/after a mandatory effect; If it is not optional, it cannot.

    An AbstractEffect can only be executed once.

    Author:
    Alessandro Fulgini

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractEffect

        public AbstractEffect(String id,
                      Match match,
                      ControllerFactory factory)
        Creates a new abstract effect with given id, attached to the given match and factory. The cost of the effect is set to zero and it does not depend on any effect.
        Parameters:
        id - Unique identifier of the effect in the weapon, not null
        match - The match which has to be controlled, not null
        factory - The factory used to create needed controllers, not null

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Returns the unique identifier of this effect in its weapon.
        Returns:
        The unique identifier of this effect in its weapon.

      • getCost

        public List<AmmoCubeCost> getCost()
        Returns the additional cost to use this effect.
        Returns:
        A map with the number of cubes of each type needed to use the effect.

      • setCost

        public void setCost(List<AmmoCubeCost> cost)
        Sets the cost to use this effect.
        Parameters:
        cost - A map with the number of cubes of each type needed to use the effect, not null

      • isOptional

        public boolean isOptional()
        Returns whether this effect is optional or not.
        Returns:
        true if the effect is optional, false otherwise

      • setOptional

        public void setOptional(boolean optional)
        Sets the effect to be mandatory or optional.
        Parameters:
        optional - true if the effect has to be optional, false if it has to be mandatory.

      • getDependsOnEffects

        public Set<String> getDependsOnEffects()
        Returns the set of effects that this effect depends on for its execution.
        Returns:
        The set with the ids of effects this effect depends on.

      • setDependsOnEffects

        public void setDependsOnEffects(Set<String> dependsOnEffects)
        Sets the set of effects that this effect depends on for its execution.
        Parameters:
        dependsOnEffects - The set with the ids of effects this effect has to depend on, not null

      • payAdditionalCost

        protected boolean payAdditionalCost(PersistentView view)
                             throws InterruptedException
        Makes the player pay for the additional cost of this effect. The items used to pay are actually removed from the player. If the player has not been able to pay the cost due to lack of items he gets notified.
        Parameters:
        view - The view of the player using the weapon, not null
        Returns:
        true if the player has been able to pay, false otherwise
        Throws:
        CancellationException - if a request to the user gets cancelled
        InterruptedException - if the thread gets interrupted

      • canBeUsed

        public boolean canBeUsed(Set<String> completedEffects)
        Returns whether this effect can be used or not based on the effects that have been successfully executed so far. This will return false if an effect that this depends on has not been executed or if this effect has already been used.
        Parameters:
        completedEffects - The set of ids of effects that have been successfully executed before this, not null
        Returns:
        true if the effect can be used, false otherwise

      • use

        public abstract boolean use(PersistentView view)
                     throws InterruptedException
        Makes the user with given view use this effect in the current state of the match, including the payment of the additional cost to use the effect. This method must be called only if the effect can actually be used. This can be checked by calling canBeUsed(Set) first. The return value indicates whether the effect has been executed successfully or not. An effect has been executed successfully if:
        • The player has been able to pay the additional cost to use it
        • The player has been able to execute all the mandatory actions in the effect (e.g. shooting targets)
        Parameters:
        view - The view of the player who wants to use this weapon, not null
        Returns:
        Whether the effect completed successfully or not
        Throws:
        CancellationException - if a request to the user gets cancelled
        InterruptedException - if the thread gets interrupted
